original: Bohman, Bengt Gottfrid, provinsialläkare, Kristdala, f. 14/3/10 i Eks-härad, Värml. 1, av kronofogde C. J. G. Bohman o, Hulda Widén. G. 40 m. Anna Elisabeth Lax. Barn i Kristina f. 41, Anders 42, Elisabeth 43, Eva 46. — Stud:ex. i Skara 28, med. kand. 31 o. med. lic. 36 i Sthlm. Undiläkivik. 37-39, undiläk. v. Hörby |]as. 39-42, v. Hässfeby sanat. 43-44, med. avd. v. Västerviks ’las. 44-45, e. proviläk. i Kristdala 45, ord. d lo 46. Marinläk istip. 36, marinläk. av 2. gr. i res. 40, av 1. gr. i res. 46.
translated:
Bohman, Bengt Gottfrid, provincial doctor (provincialläkare), Kristdala. Born on March 14th, 1910, in Eks-härad, Värmland. His parents were the Kronofogde (bailiff) C.J.G. Bohman and Hulda Widén. He married Anna Elisabeth Lax in 1940, and they had four children: Kristina (born 1941), Anders (born 1942), Elisabeth (born 1943), and Eva (born 1946). 

Bengt Gottfrid Bohman graduated from Skara School (Stud:ex.) in 1928. He received his Bachelor and License in Medicine from Stockholm in 1931 and 1936, respectively. He was an assistant doctor at Undiläkivik from 1937 to 1939, assistant doctor at Hörby |]as between 1939 and 1942, at Hässleby Sanatorium from 1943 to 1944, and a medical intern at Västerviks Hospital from 1944 to 1945. He became a provincial doctor in Kristdala in 1945 and was appointed officially in 1946.

Bohman also served as a Navy doctor, becoming a Navy doctor first class in reserve in 1946, and Navy doctor second class in reserve in 1940.
